intro: Solanum nuricum, commonly known as the narrowleaf nightshade, is a herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and potatoes. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring hairy stems and small, oval-shaped leaves. Its flowers are usually purple or violet, and it produces small, round berries that contain toxic alkaloids. Due to its toxicity, it is often considered a weed in agricultural settings.
